definition: cut off the feet/rising to a height/towering/bald

sentences.english: A turkey vulture spreads its wings in one of California's deserts.
sentences.chinese: 一只兀鹰在加州的某个沙漠里展开双翼。

sentences.english: But Zens made the liver grow back each night, and every day the vulture ate it .
sentences.chinese: 但是宙斯让他的肝每晚又复原，每天兀鹰都会来啄食。

sentences.english: He felt the creeping of fate, the circling of wolves, the hover of vultures.
sentences.chinese: 他感到命运的爬动，豺狼的包围，兀鹰的翱翔。

sentences.english: A condor for hire for photo opportunity.
These two vultures will hang above us to the end of the war.
sentences.chinese: 这两只兀鹰将在我们的头顶之上一直盘旋到战争结束。
兀鹰靠吃死动物而生存。

sentences.english: Animal flesh that rots is attractive to vultures.
sentences.chinese: 动物腐烂的肉体对兀鹰很有吸引力。

sentences.english: A lammergeier is the first on the scene.
sentences.chinese: 髭兀鹰是第一个出现的。

sentences.english: It attracts the attention of condors gliding overhead.
sentences.chinese: 同时也会吸引在周围盘旋的大兀鹰的注意。

definition: (bird species of China) northern goshawk (Accipiter gentilis)
vulture/(bird species of China) cinereous vulture (Aegypius monachus)
vulture/(bird species of China) griffon vulture (Gyps fulvus)
(bird species of China) golden eagle (Aquila chrysaetos)
variant of 鷹鵰|鹰雕[ying1 diao1]
(bird species of China) mountain hawk-eagle (Nisaetus nipalensis)/aka Hodgson's hawk-eagle
male eagle/tercel (male falcon used in falconry)
